thread.title: Texas councilman stunned, arrested while defending friends
thread.title_full: Texas councilman stunned, arrested while defending friends - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Texas councilman stunned, arrested while defending friends
text:
KHOU 11 While Prairie View Police in Texas were questioning four men, Councilman Jonathan Miller, 26, interrupted the investigation. Miller was was tasered and arrested by police in front of his home. KHOU 11 While Prairie View Police in Texas were questioning four men, Councilman Jonathan Miller, 26, interrupted the investigation. Miller was was tasered and arrested by police in front of his home. Previous Next Enlarge A Texas city councilman was stunned with a Taser while on his knees and then arrested outside his Prairie View home Thursday night — the same city where Sandra Bland was arrested.
Newly-elected Councilman Jonathan Miller identified himself as an elected official while stepping between Prairie View cops confronting four of his fraternity brothers practicing a step routine, local reports said.
The 29-year-old’s credentials, which includes a vote to rename a street after Bland, didn’t prevent what Miller’s friend described as another example of excessive force in the Houston suburb.
“It went from me asking questions to me basically being put face down on the ground,” Miller told KHOU-TV .
A video of Miller’s 8:30 p.m. arrest shows Miller on his knees before being tased. Police contend that Miller pestered them with questions and refused to step back as they questioned his house guests about suspicious activity in the neighborhood.
He allegedly pulled away as officers lunged forward with handcuffs.
“As soon as they started pushing, I pulled out my camera, because if there's a camera the officer can't say my battery on my body cam went out or anything like that,” Brandon Woodson told KPRC-TV .
Prairie View Police Department While Prairie View Police in Texas were questioning four men, Councilman Jonathan Miller, 26, interrupted the investigation. Miller was was tasered and arrested by police in front of his home. Prairie View Police Department While Prairie View Police in Texas were questioning four men, Councilman Jonathan Miller, 26, interrupted the investigation. Miller was was tasered and arrested by police in front of his home. Previous Next Enlarge A female officer involved in Thursday’s arrest was involved with Bland’s arrest, Prairie View Police Chief Larry Johnson said, but her identity has not been released. Bland was found hanging in a Waller County jail cell on July 13, three days after her arrest.
Miller faces charges of interfering with a public servant and resisting arrest.
He is no longer in custody, having bonded out of jail on Friday.
An attempt by the Daily News to reach Miller was not immediately returned.
nhensley@nydailynews.com
